channel.title: Windows server 2008 - "Your system is low on virtual memory”
channel.description:
Hi, I have a windows server and around 19 of the machines seem to all have the same issue of "Your system is low on virtual memory”, now I know the cheap fix around this is to just change the virtual memory size (which is probably only a temporary fix) however this isn't something I want to do.
Is there a way I can find the root cause of this?
Edit: Just to mention, I'm not going to install any external software.

item.title: Windows server 2008 - "Your system is low on virtual memory”
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

Okay, well I’m not too sure however I’ve investigated it a little bit and it’s my realtek gateway controllers that are causing me problems.
A quick Google search and other people have issues with a memory leak associated with controller!

Some steps I’ve taken:
Disabled LAN,
Disabled WAN,
Updated Drivers,
Downgraded Drivers,
Service Restart (the usual soft restart)
The issue is not present if I run in safe mode (with and without networking)…
Checked each driver and process thats loaded MANUALLY (painfully) I’m just left with thinking it’s a problem with ndu.sys - makes no sense to me though.

It fixes the problem if I disable it (wayyyy tooo hacky), I’m guessing they don’t like each other.

Any suggestions on how I can go around fixing this based on this log?

Read full topic
item.source: Windows server 2008 - "Your system is low on virtual memory”

item.title: Windows server 2008 - "Your system is low on virtual memory”
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“my-swagger, post:3, topic:553053”]No, the root cause will still be there.
All the processes I have running are necessary so back to my original question, how can I debug this and find the root cause? This has not been an issue in the past.
It’s also strange on how most of the machines are now having this problem.[/quote]

You could start with opening a task manager on the virtual machine to see what’s using the RAM…

Read full topic
item.source: Windows server 2008 - "Your system is low on virtual memory”

item.title: Windows server 2008 - "Your system is low on virtual memory”
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

increase your ram, increase your virtual memory, run less shit using the memory.

those are your options.
